unnormalised: Someone asked me, "How much cement is needed to build a small house in India?" Bhai, that's like asking how long is a piece of string! It all depends, na? Are you building a tiny chawl room in Mumbai, or a sprawling bungalow in Gurgaon? Cement needs are as varied as the spice levels in a Hyderabadi biryani. Seriously though, it’s gonna be more than a couple of kgs!
normalised: Someone asked me, "How much cement is needed to build a small house in India?" Bhai, that is like asking how long is a piece of string! It all depends, na? Are you building a tiny chawl room in Mumbai, or a sprawling bungalow in Gurgaon? Cement needs are as varied as the spice levels in a Hyderabadi biryani. Seriously though, it is going to be more than a couple of kilograms!

unnormalised: For a rough estimate, imagine you’re building a standard 2BHK. Let's say the total construction area is around 1000 sq ft. You'll likely need about 250-300 bags of cement (50 kg each). That's roughly 12500-15000 kgs, give or take a few bags depending on the quality of your mixture and how generous your mistri ji is feeling that day. Plus, don't forget that steel and sand need to be added to cement for strength and durability in your foundation and building.
normalised: For a rough estimate, imagine you are building a standard two B H K. Let us say the total construction area is around one thousand square feet. You will likely need about two hundred and fifty to three hundred bags of cement (fifty kilogram each). That is roughly twelve thousand five hundred to fifteen thousand kilograms, give or take a few bags depending on the quality of your mixture and how generous your mistri ji is feeling that day. Plus, do not forget that steel and sand need to be added to cement for strength and durability in your foundation and building.

unnormalised: But hey, don't just take my word for it. Get a proper construction plan from an engineer and they will give you the exact figure calculated in tonnes! Otherwise, you might end up with a house made of too much water and end up a floating house in monsoon season! Good luck building your dream home!
